title: Gaggia Classic Pro: Complete Grind Settings Guide
excerpt: Get optimal grind settings for your Gaggia Classic Pro with any grinder. Comprehensive guide with dose recommendations, temperature tips, and troubleshooting.
content:
Overview

The Gaggia Classic Pro is a legendary single-boiler espresso machine that punches above its weight class. With 15 bar pump pressure and a commercial-style 58mm portafilter, it's capable of producing exceptional espresso when dialed in correctly.

Machine Specifications

  • Pump Pressure: 15 bar (can be modded to 9 bar)
  • Boiler: Single boiler, brass
  • Group Head: 58mm commercial-style
  • Temperature Stability: Good with proper technique
  • Steam Power: Moderate (single boiler limitation)

Recommended Grind Settings

With Baratza Encore ESP

The Encore ESP is a popular budget-friendly choice:

  • Medium roast: Setting 4-6
  • Light roast: Setting 3-5 (finer for harder beans)
  • Dark roast: Setting 6-8 (coarser for softer beans)

With 1Zpresso JX-Pro

This hand grinder offers excellent value and precision:

  • Medium roast: 1.2.0 to 1.4.0
  • Light roast: 1.0.0 to 1.2.0
  • Dark roast: 1.4.0 to 1.6.0

With Niche Zero

Premium stepless grinder for ultimate control:

  • Medium roast: 12-16
  • Light roast: 10-14
  • Dark roast: 14-18

Dose Recommendations

For the standard 58mm double basket:

  • Standard dose: 18g in, 36g out (1:2 ratio)
  • Lighter roasts: 18-19g for more extraction
  • Darker roasts: 16-17g to avoid bitterness

Temperature Control

The Gaggia Classic Pro doesn't have PID temperature control out of the box, but you can use the temperature surfing technique:

  1. Turn on the machine and wait for it to heat up (ready light turns on)
  2. Run a blank shot to purge super-heated water
  3. Wait 10-15 seconds for temperature to stabilize
  4. Pull your shot immediately

For more consistency, many users install a PID kit (~$100) which allows precise temperature control.

Common Issues & Solutions

Channeling

If you see uneven flow or fast spurts:

  • Distribute grounds evenly before tamping
  • Use WDT (Weiss Distribution Technique) with a thin needle
  • Tamp with consistent pressure (30 lbs)

Sour Shots

  • Grind finer
  • Increase dose
  • Ensure proper temperature surfing
  • Check bean freshness

Bitter Shots

  • Grind coarser
  • Decrease dose
  • Use cooler temperature (temperature surf shorter)
  • Check if beans are too dark or stale

Upgrades Worth Considering

  1. PID Kit: Temperature consistency (highly recommended)
  2. OPV Mod: Reduce pressure to 9 bar (authentic espresso pressure)
  3. IMS Precision Basket: Better extraction and less channeling
  4. Better Shower Screen: More even water distribution
